value.title: AI ethics groups are repeating one of society’s classic mistakes
value.excerpt: International organizations and corporations are racing to develop global guidelines for the ethical use of artificial intelligence. Declarations, manifestos, and recommendations are flooding the internet.

value.title: A beginner’s guide to AI: Separating the hype from the reality
value.excerpt: An advanced artificial intelligence created by OpenAI, a company founded by genius billionaire Elon Musk, recently penned an op-ed for The Guardian that was so convincingly human many readers were astounded and frightened.

value.title: AI Ruined Chess. Now, It's Making the Game Beautiful Again
value.excerpt: A former world champion teams up with the makers of AlphaZero to test variants on the age-old game that can jolt players into creative patterns.

value.title: Facebook and Dolby join Amazon’s Voice Interoperability Initiative
value.excerpt: More than 70 companies now count themselves, members of Amazon's Voice Interoperability Initiative, which recently published a design guide.

value.title: Facebook is working on AR glasses with a focus on audio clarity
value.excerpt: Facebook's Reality Labs Research wing is currently working on a number of projects designed to help us cut through noisy environments and zero in on folks we're trying to hold a conversation with, or enhance our daily lives when used with AR glasses.

value.title: Meet the 8-foot-tall robot designed to insert Elon Musk's Neuralink AI brain chip — here's how it works
value.excerpt: Musk founded the neural tech company in 2016, and says the chip will enable a "symbiosis" between the human brain and AI.

value.title: AI researchers use heartbeat detection to identify deepfake videos
value.excerpt: AI researchers are using heartbeat detection to identify deepfake videos and even to figure out what kind of generative model created a deepfake.

value.title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: Amazon, Apple, salesforce.com, Zoom and Facebook
value.excerpt: Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog include: Amazon.

value.title: Facebook And Twitter Remove Russia-Backed Accounts Targeting Left-Leaning Voters
value.excerpt: Researchers say one of the operation's goals was to steer left-leaning voters away from the Biden-Harris campaign ahead of the November election.

value.title: 3 Top Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy in September
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) has the potential to influence almost every industry, and the overall economic impact of the tech will exceed what's spent on hardware, software, and services many times over.

value.title: AI Language Tool Reveals Most Stressed Politicians And Business Leaders
value.excerpt: An automated language analysis system has measured the stress levels of US politicians and business leaders, finding that Bernie Sanders is the most stressed American politician and Bill Gates the most stressed business figure.

value.title: Facebook open-sources Opacus, a PyTorch library for differential privacy
value.excerpt: Facebook's Opacus is a library for training PyTorch models with differential privacy that’s ostensibly more scalable than existing state-of-the-art methods.

value.title: Allen Institute open-sources AllenAct, a framework for research in embodied AI
value.excerpt: Researchers at the Allen Institute for AI today launched AllenAct, a platform intended to promote reproducible research in embodied AI with a focus on modularity and flexibility. AllenAct, which is available in beta,

value.title: Mia Dand’s Fight For Inclusion In The Endeavor To Save Humanity From The Dark Side Of AI
value.excerpt: Unapologetic. Unwavering. Determined. Mia Dand created 100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics and spearheaded and cultivated a strong community, which brought out necessary change in the midst of pervasive AI.

value.title: AI Weekly: Facebook’s discriminatory ad targeting illustrates the dangers of biased algorithms
value.excerpt: Flawed Facebook ad-targeting algorithms are only the latest example of AI and machine learning algorithms gone terribly awry.

value.title: Two left feet? Facebook’s new AI dance choreographer can teach you some brand new moves
value.excerpt: Facebook's AI boffins have developed a new system that creates original dance routines for any music that you feed it.

value.title: The Impact of AI on Journalism
value.excerpt: AIs write hundreds of thousands of the articles that are published by mainstream media outlets every week. What next?

value.title: Facebook Wants To Help Build AI That Can Remember Everything For You
value.excerpt: Facebook announced new AI research that could help pave the way for a significant change in how artificial intelligence — and some devices that incorporate this technology — functions in our daily lives.

value.title: Facebook’s new ’embodied A.I’ project aims to build a new breed of robots
value.excerpt: Facebook wants to build an army of robot assistants that can wait on us in all kinds of new ways. Here's what it's working on.

value.title: Facebook releases tools to help AI navigate complex environments
value.excerpt: Facebook detailed its work in embodied machine learning, including new open source data sets and modules to advance the field.

value.title: Facebook is building home robots to help you find your ringing phone
value.excerpt: Now, some new breakthroughs made by Facebook AI researchers suggest that home robots might be able to do the hard work for us, reacting to simple commands such as "bring me my ringing phone." Virtual assistants as we know them are utterly incapable of identifying a specific sound,

value.title: This CTO Says AI Technology Will Accelerate Sustainable Investing And Create A More Equitable Society
value.excerpt: ESG investing, which accounts for a company’s environmental, social and governance ratings alongside traditional financial metrics, and the concept of “stakeholder capitalism” over shareholder profitability had been growing trends even before the pandemic.

value.title: Facebook AI produces accurate MRI images 4 times faster than current tech
value.excerpt: A newly published study has validated the efficacy of a novel AI algorithm designed to deliver accurate MRI results from four times less data than usually necessary. This impressive innovation promises to dramatically speed up MRI scans without needing to upgrade pre-existing imaging hardware.

value.title: Facebook gamifies data collection to boost conversational AI
value.excerpt: In a preprint paper, Facebook researchers propose a gamified approach to collecting data to train conversational AI models.

value.title: Researchers at Facebook AI, NYU Langone Push Speed Limits of MRI
value.excerpt: The results of the joint effort, which originated at Facebook, show that accurate MRIs can be produced more quickly as AI functions with less data, researchers said.
